text: this is get eaten for the New York Times
many classic board games have made a
great transition into the digital world
monopoly which is one dollar on iOS and
two dollars on Android is a great
example of how you can take an original
board game and add some extra magic the
app has all the classic features of the
board game and instead of representing
them in boring 2d you get to see the
board and all the playing pieces in 3d
and there are even cute animations when
you're playing piece moves along the
squares you can play against an AI
inside the game or against human
opponents who can share your device or
even play on their own connected over
Wi-Fi I love the fact that you can
customize some of the playing rules and
that the app takes care of all that
difficult banking for you but I do find
that sometimes that feels weirdly
old-fashioned with the board itself and
even the interfaces harkening back to
the Past instead of being more
future-looking though of course this
doesn't take away from the actual
gameplay
if monopoly is too competitive for you
and it is for me then family classic
game of life is also available as an app
which is $1.00 on iOS and Android like
monopoly this app includes cube 3d
animations to try and add some life
ironically into the game of life its
menus are a little fiddly and the app
isn't particularly good at explaining
how to play the game so perhaps it's
best if you already know how to play the
board game version lastly if strategy
board games are more your cup of tea you
should check out Catan which is $4 on
both iOS and Android this tabletop card
game has made an excellent transition
into being an app mainly because of the
strong imagery on the cards which are
also present in the digital edition and
also because the app handles some of the
complicated game rules for you
Catan is faithful to the original game
has excellent graphics and is hard to
learn but fun to play and that's it for
me enjoy playing these board games but
don't forget about playing the real
things in person it's a very human
experience
Oh
